112.content:
It was dark and cloudy night upon the ocean. The Going Merry was traveling slowly across the Grand Line as the the pirates slept in their rooms(and Choppers doghouse). All except for one. Zoro was training his body, swinging a massive rod with hundreds of weights upon it back and forth in order to train his speed and strength.

"Darn! Still not strong enough to swing it faster." Zoro stated as he attempted to swing it back and forth as fast as he could. But the end result was a speed no faster than any ordinary swordsman. Dropping the rod and weights, Zoro said down. Completly exhausted. "I need to get stronger. I must beat Mihawk to become the best swordsman in the world." Zoro heaved as he let his body relax.

Suddenly a bright flash of light fell from the sky. Zoro looked on from afar in shock as a pillar of light came down into the ocean. "What the-!?" Zoro said in disbelief. 'There can only be one explanation for this! A person who ate the cursed fruit!' He thought as the pillar of light began to move. And towards the Going Merry at lightning speed. Realizing where it was heading, Zoro shouted as loud as he could "Everyone wake-!" But he was unable to finish as the beam completly passed through the ship, engulfing him and the bow of the ship into it. Seconds passed and the light left the bow and proceeded onwards toward whatever it's objective was. The bow of the Going Merry was completly unharmed, but something had happend to Zoro.

"Can't see!" Zoro said as he rubbed his eyes, the bright light blinding him for several minutes. Finally he began to see colors and objects until his entire sight was back in focus. And what he was seeing shocked him. "What in hell has happend!?" Zoro looked on in disbelief as he saw that the entire ship was massive! 'That beam of light must have made the ship huge!' He thought as he looked on amazed. 'Or maybe I shrunk!' Looking at himself, Zoro was shocked to see that he was tiny enough to be a foot tall or less. And his clothes were gone as well! 'Great! Now what am I supposed to do?' Thinking it over, Zoro decided exactly what he needed to do. 'I know! I'll get one of the others to find out what's wrong with me!'

He ran as fast as he could towards the cabins, treading dangerous steps and rocking barrels. Even though he was small, he was able to move as fast as any ordinary man thanks to all his training. Arriving outside the cabin doors; Zoro began to think of how to get inside 'Now how do I get in?' He thought as he looked up at the door knob. 'I could jump, but I'd probably wouldn't reach it by at least a foot.' Thinking it over, he noticed that one of the door knobs were turning. And exiting the cabin was...

"This is the necklace of the Truth," Robin said, "It's a cursed item."

"Cursed?!" Nami said, struggling to take it off. But to no avail.

Robin was exploring some ruins on an island the crew had found. She found a crystal that had an inscription on it. 12312.title: Nami finds her and laughs herself to tears at ...

choices: The man acts before Robin can do anything
1232.content:
"Welcome! Welcome! Come in!" A rusty voice called out.

Robin smiled at the young man sitting behind the counter of the little shop she had found. "Hello." She said, as she looked around the store.

Her and the crew had come to a new island in the New World, and she was pleasantly surprised to find that it was a rather peaceful one with a relaxed little town on it. After having to fight their way here all throughout the previous islands of the New World, this idyllic village was a welcome change of pace. So it only made sense that the crew would split up and go exploring on their own and, despite Sanji's protests, Robin had gone off on her own and ended up here, a lone little shop of trinkets.

"How much for this one?" Robin asked, holding up a rather plain, but chic, looking dark bracelet. She thought it looked nice with her little black dress and white hat, the same ones she had worn to Dressrosa some time ago.

"Oh, that one?" The shopkeeper looked at the item, having to quickly look away from Robin as he did. He blushed as he answered, "Uh, h-hold on..." He then went into the back of the store to look it up, it seemed.

Robin brushed it off, she was used to being stared at. It was a pain sometimes, but only really ever when she'd been recognized as a member of the Straw Hat crew. Robin hoped now wasn't one of those times. Thankfully, however, she hadn't seen a single wanted poster of herself on the island. Though it was odd for to recall that now, as now that she thought about it, there were posters for the rest of the crew, just not her.

Before Robin could ponder about that any further, the shopkeeper returned, and put a mirror up on the counter.

"Would you like to see it on yourself first, ma, ma'am?" He stuttered.

"Why, yes. Thank you." Robin said with a warm smile. She put the bracelet on and held up her arm in the mirror. It was pretty, she thought, but now the price. "How much?"

"Actually, just, um, forget about that one. Something like this might be more your, er, style?" The shopkeeper held up another accessory for Robin to look at, a little necklace. "Or, eh, just forget about forgetting about it, and take them both for, hmm, one hundred berries? H-How's that sound?" The man seemed to want to make a sale, but his nervousness was obvious.

Robin chuckled at the young man's display, but then smiled as she took a good look at the necklace he was holding. It was a small, green jeweled necklace with five jewels at the bottom, with the middle one a little larger than the rest.

Seeing her interest in it, the shopkeeper handed Robin the necklace, his hands shaking a little bit as he did. Robin paid it no mind and simply put it on, and posed some in the mirror, looking at it from various angle. She had to admit, it did look rather nice.

"It's lovely. I think I'll take them both." Robin said, handing the clerk the money. Buying into such a cheap ploy wasn't something that she usually did, but buying something sporadically felt good at times, as she'd come to realize in this second half of the grand line, with Nami's help and insistence for her to treat herself, of course.

"Please, ma'am, can't I interest you in anything else?" The man asked. He pulled some more trinkets out for her to look at. "This here is-"

"No, thank you. I really must be going now." Robin cut him off. He just stared back at her, fumbling with another piece of jewelry, as if he was trying to think of something to say to get her to stay. But Robin simply smiled at him and turned to leave.

"Um, er..." Robin could hear the man behind the counter stammer. But she paid him no real mind and kept walking.

"Thank you again." Robin said as she reached out to open the door and leave. But as she did, she noticed something odd. Her hand missed the doorknob she was about to grab. The raven-haired archeologist felt foolish for a moment, then tried again, this time grabbing a hold of the thing. She wanted to just leave then and there, but now she thought that her eyes seemed to be playing tricks on her, as it looked like the door was larger then before.

Robin blinked her eyes to try and adjust to whatever was causing this. But when she opened them again, the door seemed to be even bigger, and not only that, it seemed to be creeping upwards at an increasingly fast pace. Robin gasped as everything around her grew exponentially larger, inadvertently letting go of the door to cover her mouth as she did.

What's going on here? Could this be an enemy's trap, or... Robin wondered, already about piecing together the morbid answer.

Robin turned around and saw that the whole store was getting bigger all around her. But, Robin wasn't even sure that such a thing was possible, except for a possible devil fruit power. But then again, what use would it be for a power user to grow this store? Unless, Robin reasoned as the answer clicked in her head and she understood what had happened, she had shrunk, and by the looks of things, she was still shrinking!

Oh dear, who would've thought that I'd meet my end by being shrunken by an enemy I never saw coming... Robin thought as she continued to shrink.

Already the incredible shrinking Robin was only about a foot tall. She realized her situation was a bad one, as she was now far to small to escape the store, but she remained as calm and collected as ever, never even stepping into a fighting pose even as her height dropped further. Instead, she simply turned back around to confirm her suspicions. The door was indeed too big for her to ever even think about opening now, yet she was still too large herself to crawl under the gap below.

I could wait a while to see if I shrink enough to get out from under the door. Hmm, but I might end up shrinking into nothingness before I can get any help... Robin contemplated her options in her head.

"Not so fast!" A loud voice shouted. Robin turned around quickly to look for the source of it, but before she could, she felt something huge pick her up, then cover her in darkness. For a brief moment she felt herself get whisked up into the air, then the hand holding her opened up and she could that it was the nervous shopkeeper who had picked her up. His seemingly defining trait held true as he held Robin, with his hand shaking nervously.

The man chuckled to himself as he stared down at her miniature form with a look that was a mix between disbelief, and glee. It was a look that confused even Robin, and she wasn't quite sure what to make of it, not that she really had time to make anything of anything yet. But right now this young man was the only person there, and she wanted to know if he would help her or not...

12321.content:
Now that she was being held up next to him, Robin took notice of the man's features for the first time. Dirty blond hair that flowed neatly to just below his shoulders, and dark, narrow eyes that seemed to shine whenever he looked at her. A little pudgy, he had been tall before she shrank, rivaling even her former height, but he was a relative giant to her now.

Right now, the man was just continuing to stare down at her, with an almost hungry look. It made Robin a little nervous, but with her powers at her disposal, she wasn't too afraid.

Despite the way the man was practically ogling her tiny form, Robin decided to try and get help from him. He was, after all, the only one there, and since he already had her literally in his hands, she felt she really had no other choice but to take the chance. She just hoped that Chopper would be able to help her return to her rightful size later.

"Please, you have to help me. Take me to the port outside the village, so I can return to my crew!" Robin told the man, now standing up on his shaking palm to plead with him.

The man looked at her and...

123212.content:
"Si za za za!" The man laughed creepily. He literally shook with anticipation as he threw his head back to laugh louder, causing Robin to stumble and have to hold onto the man's thumb for support.

"C-Careful!" Robin yelled, getting irate with the giant.

"You... You don't get it, do you?" He asked, looking down at Robin. "I just shrank you!"

"..." Robin just stared up at the giant incredulously, though in the back of her mind she had a feeling that it was the case. Inwardly, she cursed herself for being so foolish at to trust the creep.

"That's right! I'm a size man! My name is Runt Bigelow!" The man introduced himself, then he pulled little Robin up closer to his face to get a better look at her. Robin, for her part, had to try hard to keep herself from gagging as his foul breath washed over her whole body. "But, you can just call me... M-Master..!"

Robin groaned at the giant's suggestion. "What is the meaning of this?!" She demanded to know. Her voice was firm, but she knew that, holding onto the man's giant thumb for dear life, she didn't look the least bit threatening.

"Oh, Robin... Nico Robin..." Runt sighed. "Let me show you something..."

Robin gulped as the man started to carry her back to the counter. She worried about what the man who wanted her to call him "Master" had in store for her.

Once at the counter, he laid his hand down for her to get off. It struck Robin as odd that he'd let her go free from his grasp if he wanted to do something bad to her, but she accepted the chance and stepped down onto the hardwood counter.

"Good. Now, I'll be right back." Runt told her as he circled around the counter and then bent down to look for something inside it.

Alone on the counter, Robin thought now would be a good time to escape, only, it struck her just now how small she had become. The accessories the shopkeeper had tried to sell her before were still there, ones that could easily fit on her before, but now magnified to gigantic size at her reduced perspective. Robin walked over to one of the rings and crouched down beside it, almost absentmindedly, and touched it. It was about half her size now.

I could wear this ring like belt, almost... Robin thought. She wasn't sure, but she guessed that she couldn't be more than three inches tall now.

She wasn't worried though, she had ample time to escape right now. So she got up and looked for an escape route. But, before she could do anything, the giant's hand came back down in front of her.

"Ah, ah, ah!" Runt said. He quickly turned the shrunken Robin around so she was facing him. "Not so fast, my little prize!"

Robin was a little disoriented from being spun so quickly, but recovered and saw that the shopkeeper was now holding up some wanted posters, of her. He put the posters down on the counter, then dropped down to pull out some more, then repeated this action again and again. Robin gasped and watched in horror as the man, clearly a demented stalker of sorts, pulled laid out dozens of her wanted posters. The shrunken archeologist realized now that this man was the reason that there were no wanted posters of her in town, the deranged fan of hers must've been collecting them for himself, and Robin could only imagine what for.

"Oh, my lovely little Robin..." Runt said softly as he organized the last of the posters together neatly. "I've been a fan of yours for a very long time. It's so nice to finally meet you."

He glared down at Robin as he spoke, though his tone was calm, Robin was nevertheless shaken by his admission. She worried about what she had just gotten herself into by coming into the man's store. Not able to spend another minute with the man, Robin ran off, not sure of where she could go, the drop from the counter was a fatal one at her height, but she had to try something, anything to get away from her insane "fan"...
123212.title: ... But receives none

choices: Luckily, Runt leaves her alone for a moment to close shop
No luck, Runt puts her into a jar for safekeeping
1232122.content:
Unfortunately for the shrunken archeologist she didn't get very far as she was blocked by a massive glass wall slamming down in front of her, stopping her in her tracks. Robin looked up and saw that she had been put under a common drinking glass. She tested the toughness of the glass by beating on it, but it had no give. Robin could see that the shopkeeper was quite pleased with where he had her, and decided to try and distract the giant for long enough for her to plan her escape.

"So, you're a Devil Fruit user?" Robin asked, surprised by her own calmness in her voice. It wasn't often that she could be caught off guard and almost helpless like this, but in this rare instance, she was, and it terrified her, though she tried not to let that show.

"Yes, that's right. I ate the Size-Size Fruit, and became a size man." Runt explained. "But you have to understand, I did it for you!"

"... I find that hard to believe." Robin said. She genuinely had no clue what the shopkeeper was talking about. But having no idea what the man's true intentions for her were made her more than a little nervous.

"Ever since I saw your wanted poster, I've been a fan. I've followed you and your crews adventures up until this point." Runt admitted, holding up one of the posters for emphasis. "So when I heard you were getting closer to this island, I was ecstatic, you see!"

"... And how does that help me?" Robin asked.

"I wanted you so bad!" Runt near shouted in response. Robin nearly flinched from the outburst. "But I knew I could never have you, at least, that's what I thought anyway. But today you confirmed it when you shut me down after I just tried to give you a deal!"

"You just wanted to sell me jun-" Robin started to say, but was cut off by Runt.

"YOU DIDN'T GIVE ME TIME TO EXPLAIN!" Runt shouted. This time, Robin was visibly shook by his outburst. "I'm sorry, I'm sorry.!" Runt apologized, dropped the poster and "cuddling" Robin's glass prison. Robin backed into the wall of her prison as the giant's hands blocked out all light for a moment, before letting up and revealing the giant's heaving face, now just in front of her field of view. Robin gasped at the sight.

"So..." Runt started up again, breathing in heavily. "I found it! I found a Devil Fruit that would help me keep you as mine, forever! Man, what a deal that was!" Runt looked pleased with himself as he seemed to recall the moment.

Robin was still shocked by the giant's sporadic attitude, but still able to piece together that the giant shopkeeper must've gotten a Devil Fruit as part of a trade somehow and ate it for the sole purpose of shrinking her down to be his little pet forever. If there was any doubt in her mind that the man had any sanity at all, it was erased now. The shopkeeper was psychotic and obsessed with her, and she knew, more then ever, that she had to get away from him.

"So now that I have you... Right. Where. I. Want. You..." Runt poked on the glass containing Robin with each word, making her lose her balance and fall onto the wooden counter. "I'm not letting you go..." Runt said, sounding almost exhausted as he sighed the words out.

Robin gulped as the insane giant's rant went on. She'd never have guessed coming into this little shop in this otherwise peaceful village would spell her doom. But here she was, shrunk to mere inches tall and trapped under an ordinary glass by a demented giant that wanted to keep her like this for the rest of her life.

It was terrifying, to say the least, but Robin wasn't giving up just yet. She still had her powers, so she could still escape. However, now wasn't the right time, she reasoned, as the giant was sure to just catch her again. She needed to bide her time and plan her escape, then she could find her crew, anyone would do, and they'd help her return to normal, preferably after beating the shopkeeper to a pulp.

But for now, she could only wait, and hope that the giant would drop his guard soon...
1232122.title: She's going nowhere!

12321221.content:
"Oh!" Runt suddenly spoke, sounding as if he'd just remembered something very important. He shot up straight and took a quick glance at the front door of the store. He grinned warmly, then turned to Robin and said, "Closing time!"

Runt left Robin alone while he closed shop for the day, leaving the reduced pirate to her thoughts. His sudden shift from menacing overlord watching over Robin's every move, back to a mousey shopkeeper was a jarring transition for the shrunken woman to behold. Something about it made his earlier actions make a little more sense, though, Robin thought. If he was able to keep up the helpful, but quiet, proprietor of the store act up before just to cover up his darker true self, then it was understandable that she'd been caught in his trap so easily. Not that she ever wanted to admit such foolishness in hindsight, but just knowing this man was capable of such trickery made her feel a little better about being tricked by it.

Robin was determined to not fall for any of Runt's tricks again. So she took the time he'd inadvertently given her to escape.

At first, Robin again tried to lift her glass prison up, but again to no avail. It wasn't an especially large glass by normal means, but to Robin's 3-inch scale and adjusted strength, it might as well have been like trying to lift Impel Down up from the ocean floor.

Robin grunted and let go of the glass. Even if she used her devil fruit powers it wasn't likely to help much, as her sprouted limbs were only as strong as she was. She'd have to try something else, she knew. Robin noticed the little slack the glass gave when she tried to lift it, and figured that maybe pushing it instead would be the way out of this mess.

Flexing her arms, Robin braced herself to move the glass that was nearly twice her current little height. Minuscule hands on the cold glass, Robin pushed with all her might and, to some surprise, she found that she was able to scoot the glass a little bit. Robin smiled, thinking she'd finally have some semblance of hope soon.

The shrunken woman pushed again, harder this time, and the glass neared the edge of the counter. One more push and she'd be able to drop the glass prison and escape. The only problem was that her captor would no doubt hear the glass shatter on the floor below, and she'd again be in trouble of being captured. But Robin wasn't concerned with that too much, she just wanted out, and she knew that if she were fast enough, she'd be able to get down from this accursed counter and hide, hopefully long enough to escape the creep entirely and get help from her crew.

So Robin gave the glass a final, strong push, and sure enough, it fell. Robin reacted quickly and ducked down to avoid being taken out with the backside of the glass. The next thing she knew, the glass hit the floor below and shattered on impact.

"What the..!?" Came a distant shout from Runt. Already Robin could hear the giant man's footsteps coming back to her, and she knew she'd have to move fast if she wanted to make a clean getaway.

Robin got up as fast as she could and prepared to use her devil fruit powers to create a "ladder" of limbs to help her get down, then, once on the floor she'd hide and get out of the store. She folded her arms across her chest as usual and prepared to sprout her escape route...
12321221.title: Breaking the glass ceiling

choices: Runt feels bad for Robin and tries to 'cheer' her up
Runt wants to play with his new 'pet'
123212213.content:
"Cien fluers!" Robin cried as she tried to summon her devil fruit powers to her aid. But, to her surprise, nothing happened. Robin gasped and opened her eyes. She gasped again, but this time in horror, as she saw the large form of Runt standing over her, grinning creepily down at her helpless, shrunken state.

"No, no, no..." He wagged his finger at the miniature beauty. "That's not going to work in my store."

"Wh-What did you do to me?" Robin asked, shocked by the fear in her own voice. It wasn't often she'd be caught completely off guard like this, but in the rare instances she was, it was only because she was afraid it was a hopeless situation.

"Isn't it obvious!? I took your powers away! Si za za!" Runt laughed at Robin's reaction. He reached down and scooped the 3-inch tall woman into his hand, closing it around her, and blocking her from seeing anything.

Robin gulped. Her situation had just gone from bad to worse. She'd already been shrunk, but now she was learning that this man had somehow taken away the use of her devil fruit powers. But Robin couldn't figure out how that was possible, as far as she knew there was no way it'd be possible without the use of sea prism stone, and since the man was a devil fruit user himself, that wasn't likely to her. Unless the size size fruit also somehow granted her captor the ability to remove her powers, it made no sense to the increasingly terrified tiny brunette.

Her mind was wracked with possibilities, and reworking her thinking of how to better escape from this store without use of her powers, all while she rode uncomfortably in the giant's huge, sweaty fist. He had the upper hand on her, quite literally, the whole time. But she wasn't about to give up, even without her powers she'd make it out of here, 3 inches tall or not.

Minutes seemed to pass during the ride, until finally she was tossed by Runt onto another hard surface. Tiny Robin rolled out onto the new room, but a moment later crashed into a soft wall. Robin was a little disorientated from all the movement. She rubbed her head and tried to recollect herself. She looked behind herself to see what she ran into, and nearly screamed when she saw it was her captor's giant hand, apparently 'softening' the blow of being tossed about like some unwanted toy.

"Sorry! Sorry, my little Robin pet!" Runt cooed apologetically. Robin groaned inwardly, he might not have thought of her as a toy, but a pet was just as bad in her mind. "Are you hurt?"

Robin quickly backed away from the giant hand and scurried into a corner. She got a look around the room, from what she could tell it looked like the back of the store and it was filled with product and some crates, but it also seemed to double as a bedroom for the owner. She was on a desk of some sort, maybe one that the man used to do his inventory or something like that, judging from the myriad of papers and pen and pencil holders. Runt was sitting down in a chair looking down at her. She shouted at him, "What did you do to me!?"

"Oh... You're good. I'm glad I didn't hurt you!" Runt sighed in relief, seemingly genuinely worried for Robin's well-being. "Sorry for the rough landing."

Robin shook her head, she didn't want the man's twisted care. "What did you do to me? How did you take my powers away?" She repeated frantically.

"Ahh..." Runt chuckled smugly. He seemed to take joy in having outsmarted his beloved Robin. "It was pretty simple actually. Sea prism stone. You see?" He pointed to the watch on his arm.

It took Robin a second to realize that his motion was meant to infer to her about the bracelet he'd given her earlier. Robin gasped in stunned realization as she looked at her seemingly normal bracelet.

"That's right. I put the stone in there. Then I used my size size powers to shrink it to a more manageable size. Did you know that if you shrink something with my powers, it gets weaker? That's why you weren't able to feel its effects right away..." Runt then chuckled to himself again, smacking his forehead playfully. "Oh, of course you know that, judging from your time under that glass!"

Robin just glared up at the giant. She felt close to tears by this point, but after he'd revealed his secret to her, she thought of something. Robin quickly pulled at the bracelet on her arm and tried to take it off, but before she could she heard the man scream,

"Size Size Reduce!" Suddenly a beam of light shot out and struck the bracelet Robin was wearing. It instantly shrank down on her arm, becoming a tight fit, and making removing it near impossible. Robin gasped and tugged at the bracelet some more, but it was no use, it was way too small and tight for to get off.

"Si za za!" Runt cackled. "How do you like that, fits nicely, doesn't it?"

Robin looked at the giant defiantly, and tried again and again to get off the accursed bracelet, but it was impossible. Robin eventually gave up and collapsed to her knees. She started to tear up, things were looking increasingly hopeless for her, and now she learned that she'd been powerless to fight back almost since she walked in. Whoever this creep of an owner was, he'd obviously been planned her abduction for quite some time, and was taking great joy in finally reducing and humiliating her. Robin sobbed.
123212213.title: Shrunken and powerless

Robin is reminiscing about all that's happened on the ship when she shrinks.
1233.content: Princess Vivi found a book in the palace library shortly after the Enies Lobby Incident where she found out "Miss All Sunday" was now a Straw Hat. She was a little shocked but didn't have a grudge against Robin like she did with Crocodile. She knew Robin herself had suffered at that bastard's hands too. She was even slightly grateful to the woman for sparing Igaram at Whiskey Peak and saving Luffy after his first fight with Crocodile. However, she still thought it would be fun to mess with her a little bit. Her spies had informed her that the straw hats were having a little vacation on an island after a run in with Gekko Moriah (she and her father knew what the World Goverment never reported through their own connections). Knowing the Straw Hats weren't in any danger, she decide to use the book's incantations of magic to cause Robin to shrink. The best part was that any clothing worn at the time DID NOT shrink with her. "Sanji will have a field day with this. In fact, Luffy might start to realize his feelings for Robin too. She did save him after all and he's repaid that twice with Crocodile and CP9". "This will be both fun and match-make Luffy and Robin together" thought Vivi. She got an evil grin on her face. " Brace yourself Robin" she thought as she read the incantation to shrink the devil fruit user.
1233.title: She gets cursed to shrink

12331.content:
Robin sighs in contentment as she lets the sun's rays wash over her, it had been so long since she'd actually been able to drop her guard and relax, sure as Miss All Sunday she'd been able to move as she pleased but she was still subject to Crocodile's whims, here there was no obligation to do anything, the clearest example being Zoro who was currently sleeping against the side of her ship.

Her contentment was sullied when her bikini top, which was previously stretched tight over her large breasts, started to loosen, thinking the knot had come undone she moves to check, only then did she see it was much more than a simple knot, the fabric practically ballooned out as her own form dwindled, finally stopping at a miniature 5 inches, after she'd pulled herself from the pile of cloth that were here bikini top and bottoms she began to consider her options as well as an explanation. How did she shrink? Was it an attack? Devil Fruit related? Magic curses? Some weird Grand Line phenomenon? Was she the only on affected? 15522221211.content:
"Ughh.. What happened?" Nami asked herself as she rubbed her eyes open from her nap. She remembered landing on a strange island and falling asleep after eating some fruit with Luffy. But now, as she looked around, she couldn't tell where she was, or see any sign of Luffy for that matter. The grass was huge, and so was the bushes around. The bushes had what looked like gigantic fruit on them, and Nami couldn't help but feel like she had seen it before.

"What in the..?" Nami asked, wide-eyed as she saw her huge surroundings. The sheer size of everything was nearly giving her vertigo so she looked and to collect her thoughts, and then she saw that she was naked!

"KYAAHH!" Nami cried, and instinctively covered herself. "What happened to my clothes!?"

She found her answer when she saw what appeared to be her green bikini top and blue jeans below her, but they were huge now and she felt like a tiny little thing standing on top of them. Then it clicked for the navigator, the huge plants and fruit and her now way oversized clothes, she must've shrunk somehow!

Okay, Nami, don't freak out! Don't freak out! She thought to herself. She started walking backwards over her giant clothes absentmindedly and nearly tripped over them before touching the ground beneath. She caught herself and looked behind herself and saw a beetle, the size of a large dog! Nami gasped and tried to stay calm, but when the bug scuttled into her tiny, nude form, Nami lost it.

"WAAGHH!" Nami cried. The shrunken woman threw her hands and up and ran away from the giant insect. Meanwhile, the innocent creature simply scurried off into the grass, frightened by the tiny woman's cries.

WIth tears comically flowing down her face, the tiny and terrified Nami ran across her oversized clothing, not watching where she was going. She bumped into some rubbery and fell down.

"Ugh..." Nami groaned, rubbing her head. She looked up and saw that it was her captain, Luffy, who she had run into. "Luffy..?" She called out to him.

"Nami!" Luffy shouted gleefully. He had just gotten up himself and had been looking around his newly expanded surroundings. Luffy offered Nami his hand, which she gratefully accepted. When Nami got to her feet she took sighed in relief that Luffy was, and then decided to explain the situation to her captain.

"Luffy, listen, we shrunk somehow." Nami explained.

"Yeah. No kidding." Luffy said with a big grin on his face. Nami thought his reaction to their shared prediciment was a little odd, but didn't may it much mind and instead went on to explain.

"Okay... I know that this is-" Nami tried to say, but was interrupted by Luffy.

"It's so cool!" Luffy exclaimed with a chuckle.

"Wha!?" Nami was astonished at Luffy seemingly enjoying being so small.

"Isn't this cool, Nami?!" Luffy asked her. The smile that stretched from ear-to-ear never leaving his face. He reached out and grabbed Nami's shoulder, as if to encourage her to be excited about their shrinking.

"No! We're only like six inches tall now!" Nami shouted, annoyed by her captain's behavior. She knocked Luffy's hand off of her shoulder, then she gasped, having remembered her nudity while in the motion. "And we're naked!" Nami cried, and immediately covered her front with her hands, and backing away from Luffy.

"Oh, sorry." Luffy apologized, blushing and turning away from Nami.

Not only was Nami in the nude now, Luffy was almost just as naked as her. Except for his signature straw hat, which had mysteriously shrunk with the rubber man. Luffy didn't mind himself being seen naked in front of Nami though, and was just turning away for the sake of her modesty.

"Hey, wait a minute..." Nami started slowly. She took a step towards Luffy. "Your hat didn't shrink! What's that about?"

"Hmm?" Luffy murmured, touching the base of his straw hat. "Oh yeah, I guess it didn't. Weird, huh?"

"Whatever. Like any of this makes sense anyway." Nami said. She noticed Luffy was still looking away from her. She smiled a little, happy that her captain was respecting her modesty. With a sly grin and a glimmer in her eyes, she lowered her arms and told him, "You can look if you want, Luffy."

Luffy gulped, and slowly turned around to face Nami. He felt his face turn even redder as he saw her. She was just standing there, letting herself be seen by him. If Luffy had been more like a certain perverse cook, he might've had a nose-bleed right then and there. But instead, he just wanted to tell her how good she looked, even if it wasn't exactly appropriate.

"Nami, you're beauti-" Luffy started to tell her his feelings, but Nami suddenly shouted.

"... For one million berries, that is!" Nami told Luffy seductively, and rubbed her fingers together to signify money. Luffy nearly fell over upon hearing Nami's ridiculous amount, he stood shocked.

"One million berries! You're kidding me!" Luffy cried. Nami shook her head.

"Nope! You've seen it, now you're going to have to pay up!" Nami said slyly.

"I can't believe you tricked me!" Luffy whined. Nami grinned.

"Of course, I don't expect the money right now, so I'll wait until we're back to the ship!" She told Luffy, blushing a little despite herself.

Luffy hung his head, thinking that he'd have to pay off his navigator now, while Nami laughed at her successful play.

"But seriously, Luffy. We need to figure out what caused us to shrink and how we can grow back to our normal sizes!" Nami said. Luffy huffed, still feeling burned, but nodded his agreement.

The two shrunken pirates didn't have much time to think about anything else afterwards though, as next...

“We want to come with you, so……”

“We just took a ride on the ship,” Aphelandra finished.

The crew was paying to much attention on Margret’s friends when Hancock went to check on her two sisters.

“Are you two alright?” Hancock asked as Sandersonia and Marigold replied.

“We’re fine. But the marks on our backs are gone,”

Hancock was shocked and lookedt her sister’s backs and saw the slave marks were gone. Sandersonia and Marigold looked on Hancock’s back and saw that her mark was gone as well.

“We’re free,” Hancock thought as Ran asked.

“Hime-sama, Why haven’t we turn to stone? What about your-“

“It’s seems to be gone from us being shrunk,” Hancock replied.

“What do we do with Sweat Pea and Aphelandra?” Ran asked.

Hancock was about to reply until Luffy asked.

“Let’s let them stay. It’s not like we can doing anything,”

“Oh Yes Luffy!” Hancock said with a smile. The two Boa sisters sighed.

“Well, since you two shrunk the rest of the other crew. Let’s go and get our clothes back just in case we return to normal,” Nami said as Luffy and the others agreed.

After an hour of getting Luffy, Nami, Robin, Margret, and Hancock giant clothes back on the ship and putting all of the clothes inside. Everyone was sweating.

“That was hard work,” Nami said as she remembers that she always let the other straw hats take care of the labor work.

“What do we do now?” Robin asked as they still had day light left.
